page.title: 06Guisborough Market
page.content: The market in Guisborough has been held every week since the middle ages.It stretches up Westgate, the main street, for about 300 yards on each side, and on the day I was studying it consisted of about 45 stalls. It lasts from 8.30 a.m. until about 5.00 p.m.every Thursday and Saturday. The goods sold include fruit & vegetables, meat, clothes, kitchen utensils, bedding and crockery. In summer the market attracts many tourists. One stall-holder selling ladies' garments travelled 350 miles a week and went to Knaresborough, Leyburn & Richmond markets as well.Another, selling hankies & window leathers, travelled 1,000 miles, & went to Darlington,Stockton, Leyburn, Ripon & Selby.A luggage seller went as far as Blyth, Hexham & Morpeth.The market causes much traffic congestion.
